contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=April 2008}} '''Operation Addition''' was the name given to the [[Canada|Canadian]] contribution to [[United Nations Mission in Ethiopia and Eritrea]], the [[United Nations]] peacekeeping forces in [[Ethiopia]] and [[Eritrea]] after the [[Eritrean–Ethiopian War]]. It began in late 2000 with [[Operation Eclipse]] during which the Canadians worked as part of a joint battle group with the Dutch peace-keeping forces. The Canadian contingent was part of an international team monitoring the Temporary Security Zone between Ethiopia and Eritrea. The commitment ended in June 2003.<ref>http://www.cefcom.forces.gc.ca/pa-ap/ops/addition-eng.asp</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Military operations involving Canada]] [[Category:Canada–Ethiopia relations]] {{Canada-mil-hist-stub}}
